final_answer.precision_note: Current and time are each 3 s.f., so the deposited copper mass is reported as 0.889 g (3 s.f.).

method: Time is 30.0 min = 1800 s. Charge passed: Q = It = 1.50 x 1800 = 2700 C. Moles of electrons: n(e-) = Q/F = 2700/96500 = 0.02798 mol. From Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, two electrons deposit one Cu atom, so n(Cu) = 0.02798/2 = 0.01399 mol. Using Cu atomic mass 63.55, mass deposited = n x Ar = 0.01399 x 63.55 = 0.889 g.
checks: Dimensional flow is consistent: A x s gives C, then C/(C mol-1) gives mol.
Cu amount is half electron amount due to 2e- per Cu in the half-equation.
